titles.title: Jesus Christ, Our Blessed Savior
Jesus Christ Our Redeemer Born, Christ Who Freed Our Souls From Danger, Jesus Christ Our God and Savior

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Jesus Christ, our Blessed Savior, Turned away God's wrath forever; Suff'ring pains no tongue can tell, He saved us from the pains of hell.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: To remind us that, to save us He hath died, His flesh He gave us With this bread, a quick'ning food, And with this wine, His precious blood.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Whoso to this board repaireth, Take good heed how He prepareth; Death instead of life shall He Receive who comes unworthily.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Praise the Father, God in heaven, Who such dainty food hath given, And for misdeeds thou hast done Gave to die His beloved Son.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Thou shalt hold with faith unshaken, That this food is to be taken By the sick who are distressed, By those whose heart is sin\oppressed.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
To such grace and mercy turneth
Every soul that truly mourneth;
Art thou well? Avoid this board,
Else thou reapest an ill reward.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines:
Christ says: "Come ye heavy-laden,
I your weary hearts will gladden;
They that are yet strong and well,
Despise the best physician's skill.

verse.name: v8
verse.lines:
Couldst thou earn thine own salvation,
Useless were my death and passion;
This feast is not spread for thee,
If thine own helper thou wilt be.

verse.name: v9
verse.lines:
If thou this believest truly,
And confession makest duly,
Thou a welcome guest art here,
This heavenly food thy soul shall cheer.

verse.name: v10
verse.lines:
But the fruits must not be missing,
Love thy neighbor without ceasing,
That true love let him receive,
Which here to thee thy God doth give.
